009package imagingbook.common.ransac;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.List;
013import java.util.Random;
014
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Primitive2d;
018import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.DialogLabel;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
021
022/**
023 * Generic RANSAC detector for 2D primitives. This abstract class defines the core RANSAC
024 * functionality used by all derived (concrete) classes.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/11/19
028 * 
029 * @see RansacLineDetector
030 * @see RansacCircleDetector
031 * @see RansacEllipseDetector
032 * @see Primitive2d
033 *
034 * @param <T> generic type extending {@link Primitive2d}
035 */
036public abstract class RansacDetector<T extends Primitive2d> {
037        
038        /**
039         * Parameters used by all RANSAC types.
040         */
041        public static class RansacParameters implements ParameterBundle<RansacDetector<?>> {
042                        
043                /** The number of iterations (random point draws) to use in each detection cycle.*/
044                @DialogLabel("Number of random draws") 
045                public int randomPointDraws = 1000;
046                
047                /** The maximum distance of any point from the curve to be considered an "inlier".*/
048                @DialogLabel("Max. inlier distance") 
049                public double maxInlierDistance = 2.0;
050                
051                /** The minimum number of inliers required for successful detection.*/
052                @DialogLabel("Min. inlier count") 
053                public int minInlierCount = 100;
054                
055                /** Set true to remove inlier points after each detection.*/
056                @DialogLabel("Remove inliers") 
057                public boolean removeInliers = true;
058                
059                /** Random seed used initialization (0 = no seed).*/
060                @DialogLabel("Random seed (0 = no seed)") 
061                public int randomSeed = 0;
062        }
063        
064        // -----------------------------------------------------------
065        
066        private final RansacParameters params;
067        private final int K;                                            // number of points to draw
068        private final RandomDraw<Pnt2d> randomDraw;     // 
069        
070        RansacDetector(int K, RansacParameters params) {
071                this.K = K;
072                this.params = params;
073                Random rand = (params.randomSeed == 0) ? null : new Random(params.randomSeed);
074                this.randomDraw = new RandomDraw<>(rand);
075        }
076        
077        // -----------------------------------------------------------
078        
079//      /**
080//       * Returns this detector's random generator. This can be used, e.g.,
081//       * to set its seed (by {@link Random#setSeed(long)}).
082//       * 
083//       * @return the random generator
084//       */
085//      public Random getRandom() {
086//              return this.rand;
087//      }
088        
089        // ----------------------------------------------------------
090        
091        /**
092         * Performs iterative RANSAC steps on the supplied image,
093         * which is assumed to be binary (all nonzero pixels are considered
094         * input points).
095         * Extracts the point set from the image and calls {@link #detectAll(Pnt2d[], int)}.
096         * 
097         * @param bp a binary image (nonzero pixels are considered points)
098         * @param maxCount the maximum number of primitives to detect
099         * @return the list of detected primitives
100         */
101        public List<RansacResult<T>> detectAll(ByteProcessor bp, int maxCount) {
102                Pnt2d[] points = IjUtils.collectNonzeroPoints(bp);
103                if (points.length == 0) {
104                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("empty point set");
105                }
106                return detectAll(points, maxCount);
107        }
108        
109        /**
110         * Performs iterative RANSAC steps on the supplied point set until
111         * either no more primitive was detected or the maximum number
112         * of primitives was reached.
113         * Iteratively calls {@link #detectNext(Pnt2d[])} on the specified
114         * point set.
115         * 
116         * @param points the original point set
117         * @param maxCount the maximum number of primitives to detect
118         * @return the list of detected primitives
119         */
120        public List<RansacResult<T>> detectAll(Pnt2d[] points, int maxCount) {
121                List<RansacResult<T>> primitives = new ArrayList<>();
122                int cnt = 0;
123                
124                RansacResult<T> sol = detectNext(points);
125                while (sol != null && cnt < maxCount) {
126                        primitives.add(sol);
127                        cnt = cnt + 1;
128                        sol = detectNext(points);
129                }
130                return primitives;
131        }
132        
133        /**
134         * Performs a single RANSAC step on the supplied point set. 
135         * If {@link RansacParameters#removeInliers} is set true, 
136         * all associated inlier points are removed from the point set (by setting
137         * array elements to {@code null}).
138         * 
139         * @param points an array of {@link Pnt2d} instances (modified)
140         * @return the detected primitive (of generic type T) or {@code null} if unsuccessful
141         */
142        public RansacResult<T> detectNext(Pnt2d[] points) {
143                Pnt2d[] drawInit = null;
144                double scoreInit = -1;
145                T primitiveInit = null;
146                
147                for (int i = 0; i < params.randomPointDraws; i++) {
148                        Pnt2d[] draw = drawRandomPoints(points);
149                        T primitive = fitInitial(draw);
150                        if (primitive == null) {
151                                continue;
152                        }
153                        double score = countInliers(primitive, points);
154                        if (score >= params.minInlierCount && score > scoreInit) {
155                                scoreInit = score;
156                                drawInit = draw;
157                                primitiveInit = primitive;
158                        }
159                }
160                
161                if (primitiveInit == null) {
162                        return null;
163                }
164                else {
165                        // refit the primitive to all inliers:
166                        Pnt2d[] inliers = collectInliers(primitiveInit, points);
167                        T primitiveFinal = fitFinal(inliers);   
168                        if (primitiveFinal != null)
169                                return new RansacResult<T>(drawInit, primitiveInit, primitiveFinal, scoreInit, inliers);
170                        else
171                                throw new RuntimeException("final fit failed!");
172                }
173        }
174        
175        /**
176         * Randomly selects {@link #K} unique points from the supplied {@link Pnt2d} array.
177         * Inheriting classes may override this method to enforce specific constraints 
178         * on the selected points (e.g., see {@link RansacLineDetector}).
179         * 
180         * @param points an array of {@link Pnt2d} instances
181         * @return an array of {@link #K} unique points
182         */
183        Pnt2d[] drawRandomPoints(Pnt2d[] points) {      
184                return randomDraw.drawFrom(points, K);
185        }
186        
187        private int countInliers(T curve, Pnt2d[] points) {
188                int count = 0;
189                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
190                        if (p != null) {
191                                double d = curve.getDistance(p);
192                                if (d < params.maxInlierDistance) {
193                                        count++;
194                                }
195                        }
196                }
197                return count;
198        }
199        
200        /**
201         * Find all points that are considered inliers with respect to the
202         * specified curve and the value of {@link RansacParameters#maxInlierDistance}.
203         * If {@link RansacParameters#removeInliers} is set true, these
204         * points are also removed from the original point set, otherwise
205         * they remain.
206         * 
207         * @param curve
208         * @param points
209         * @return
210         */
211        private Pnt2d[] collectInliers(Primitive2d curve, Pnt2d[] points) {
212                List<Pnt2d> pList = new ArrayList<>();
213                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
214                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
215                        if (p != null) {
216                                double d = curve.getDistance(p);
217                                if (d < params.maxInlierDistance) {
218                                        pList.add(p);
219                                        if (params.removeInliers) {
220                                                points[i] = null;
221                                        }
222                                }
223                        }
224                }
225                return pList.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
226        }
227        
228        // abstract methods to be implemented by specific sub-classes: -----------------------
229        
230        /**
231         * Fits an initial primitive to the specified points.
232         * This abstract method must be implemented by inheriting classes,
233         * which must also specify the required number of initial points ({@link #K}).
234         * 
235         * @param draw an array of exactly {@link #K} points
236         * @return a new primitive of type T
237         */
238        abstract T fitInitial(Pnt2d[] draw);
239        
240        /**
241         * Fits a primitive to the specified points.
242         * This abstract method must be implemented by inheriting classes.
243         * 
244         * @param inliers an array of at least {@link #K} points
245         * @return a new primitive of type T.
246         */
247        abstract T fitFinal(Pnt2d[] inliers);
248        
249}
